thread.title: New York City Must Boost School Attendance For Homeless Students, Comptroller Says

author: Corinne Ramey
title: New York City Must Boost School Attendance For Homeless Students, Comptroller Says

organizations.name: new york city must boost school attendance for homeless students

text:
New York City Comptroller Scott Stringer on Saturdaycalled for policies to increase school attendance of homeless children, following an audit that found more than half of students in shelters were chronically absent from public schools.
Some 33,000 children who were enrolled in public schools lived in shelters during the 2015-2016 school year, with 58% chronically absent, according to the comptrollerâ€™s office.
